definition: reactionaries
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie

sentences.english: We definitely do not apply a policy of benevolence to the reactionaries.
sentences.chinese: 我們對反動派決不施仁政。

sentences.english: All reactionaries are paper tigers. In appearance, the reactionaries are terrifying, but in reality they are not sopowerful.
sentences.chinese: 一切所有號稱強大的反動派統統不過是紙老虎。

sentences.english: The reactionaries will never, of their own accord, step down from the stage of history.
sentences.chinese: 反動派決不會自行退出歷史舞臺。

sentences.english: The reactionaries crushed the movement of the students into submission.
sentences.chinese: 反動派鎮壓了學生運動。

sentences.english: A politically ultraconservative or reactionary person.
sentences.chinese: 我們要鄙視一切反動派。

sentences.english: The reactionaries work hand-in-glove with the imperialists to suppress the national liberation movement.
sentences.chinese: 反動派同帝國主義狼狽爲奸，鎮壓民族解放運動。

sentences.english: In the late 1960s, he was branded a reactionary and sent to a labor camp for two years.
sentences.chinese: 60年代末，他被化爲反動派，送去勞動改造兩年。

sentences.english: Reactionaries are always blind to the strength of the people.
sentences.chinese: 反動派總是看不見人民的力量。

sentences.english: All reactionaries will come to no good.
sentences.chinese: 一切反動派都沒有好下場。

sentences.english: All reactionaries are paper tigers. In appearance, the reactionaries are terrifying, but in reality they are not so powerful.
sentences.chinese: 一切所有號稱強大的反動派統統不過是紙老虎。

sentences.english: The speaker stood on a table, reviling at the evil doings of the reactionaries.
sentences.chinese: 那位演講者站在桌上痛斥反動派的罪惡行徑。

sentences.english: The reactionaries work hand-in-glove with the imperialists to suppress the national liberation.
sentences.chinese: 反動派和帝國主義互相勾結，鎮壓民族解放運動。

sentences.english: The reactionaries cooked up various schemes to deceive the people.
sentences.chinese: 反動派想出各種花樣來欺騙人民。

sentences.english: We shall never be cowed by the bluster of reactionaries .
sentences.chinese: 我們決不會被反動派的氣勢洶洶所嚇倒。

definition: Liberation city district/Jiefang district of Jiaozuo city 焦作市[Jiao1 zuo4 shi4], Henan
Zhang Guotao (1897-1979), Chinese communist leader in the 1920s and 1930s, defected to Guomindang in 1938
abbr. for 國家安全局|国家安全局[Guo2 jia1 An1 quan2 ju2]
Autumn Harvest Uprising (1927), insurrection in Hunan and Jiangxi provinces led by Mao Zedong
student movement
conflict/internal strife/dissension
royalists
to meet on the battlefield (idiom)
to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
guerrilla band
to betray one's country
to execute by firing squad/same as 槍斃|枪毙
betrayal/defection/turncoat/to change sides politically
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: government army
hegemonism
